** Documentation ** of the lexicon files for
gt/sme/src/sme-lex.txtthe main continuation lexica for N, A, V,
the lexicon files for the various POS, nouns: gt/sme/src/noun-sme-lex.txt,
adjectives: gt/sme/src/adj-sme-lex.txt,
verbs: gt/sme/src/verb-sme-lex.txt,
adverbs: gt/sme/src/adv-sme-lex.txt,
pronouns, conjunctions, subjunctions, interjections and particles: gt/sme/src/closed-sme-lex.txt,
adpositions, prepositions and postpositions: gt/sme/src/pp-sme-lex.txt,
proper nouns: gt/sme/src/propernoun-sme-lex.txt,
abbreviations: gt/sme/src/abbr-sme-lex.txt and
punctuation marks: gt/sme/src/punct-sme-lex.txt

For North Sami, we use a perl script, gt/script/preprocess, cf. the documentation. Documentation of the old xfst-based preprocessor gt/sme/src/tok.txt is found here (the documentation contains a general discussion of preprocessing as well). We may return to using tokenize when the code is stable):

Documentation of gt/sme/src/case.regex, the file for initial capitalisation, and gt/sme/src/allcaps.regex, the file for words written in all-caps, and gt/sme/src/cap-sme, the lookup script for invoking allcaps.regex
Lookup gives Xerox-style output, we need vislcg-type input, the transition is done with the script gt/script/lookup2cg
We guess the POS of unknown words in running text with the gt/sme/src/sme-guess.txt (still under construction)
Incoming text contains foreign words. We have a very long list of wordforms in Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Danish and English, gt/script/foreign.txt, cf. the documentation

section.title: Compiling
section.p: The programs are compiled (i.e. made), by writing make (or, if you like to know how long time it takes, write the command as time make) when standing in the src/ directory. The make command invokes the Makefile.
